page.title: 17ABBOT'S WOOD/WILMINGTON F.
page.content: ABBOT'S WOOD IS A PART OF WILMINGTON FOREST-A WORKING FOREST COVERING 880 ACRES.25% OF THE TREES ARE BROAD LEAVED-OAK,BEECH,POPLAR,BIRCH,ALDER,HO RNBEAM.THE REST ARE MAINLY CONIFERS- CORSICAN PINE,NORWAY SPRUCE, WESTERN HEMLOCK. THE FOREST PRODUCES @ 1400 TONS OF TIMBER A YEAR. THERE ARE MANY LOVELY WALKS AND A SMALL LAKE WHICH CAN BE FISHED. THERE ARE MANY WILD BIRDS INHABITING THE FOREST AND IN SPRING WILD FLOWERS ARE EVERYWHERE. THERE ARE SOME VERY LARGE NESTS-UP TO 3 FEET HIGH WHICH HAVE BEEN BUILT BY WOOD ANTS FROM FOREST DEBRIS. RABBITS,FOXES AND BADGERS ARE FOUND IN THE WOOD. I LIKE ABBOT'S WOOD BECAUSE THERE'S A LAKE WHICH IS GOOD FOR CATCHING DACE. ALSO IT'S GOOD FOR ITS WILD LIFE ESPECIALLY A GOOD SELECTION OF BEETLES
